items.title: Melania Trump Says She Has Been Working With Putin to Reunite Missing Ukrainian Children
items.summary: “President Putin and I have had an open line of communication regarding the welfare of these children,” the first lady announced.

items.title: Trump Administration Disapproves of Machado’s Nobel Prize, but Rubio Has Been a Big Supporter
items.summary: Marco Rubio was among eight Republican lawmakers who last year called the Venezuelan opposition leader “courageous and selfless” in a Nobel Prize nomination letter. Trump wanted the honor.

items.title: Peter M. Fishbein, Lawyer Accused in Savings-and-Loan Lawsuit, Dies at 91
items.summary: His firm’s $41 million settlement in representing Charles H. Keating Jr. raised questions about government overreach.

items.title: Under Trump, E.P.A. Explored if Abortion Pills Could Be Detected in Wastewater
items.summary: Scientists at the Environmental Protection Agency found that they could develop methods to identify traces of the medication if necessary — a practice long sought by the anti-abortion movement.

items.title: Explosion at Tennessee Ammunition Plant Leaves Multiple Dead and Several Others Missing
items.summary: A number of people were missing after a “devastating blast” at Accurate Energetic Systems, about 60 miles southwest of Nashville, a county sheriff said.

items.title: White House Signals Federal Layoffs Have Begun Amid Government Shutdown
items.summary: The head of the White House budget office said on Friday that reductions in force had started.

items.title: Federal layoffs have started, Trump’s budget chief says, as Congress remains deadlocked over funding to end shutdown – live
items.summary: <p>Russ Vought, Trump’s OMB chief and Project 2025 architect, says federal ‘reductions in force’ have begun on 10th day of government shutdown</p><p>As the shutdown enters its 10th day, and both chambers are out of session today, House speaker <strong>Mike Johnson</strong> has defended not passing a separate bill that would keep members of the military paid throughout the shutdown.</p><p>“Republicans have voted to OPEN the government and get our troops, Border Patrol, TSA, and veterans PAID,” Johnson said, before blaming Democratic leadership for refusing to pass the House-passed continuing resolution. “Chuck Schumer is terrified of a challenge from the Marxist left – so he and the Democrats voted to CLOSE the government-and to STOP PAYCHECKS from being issued.”</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/10/letitia-james-donald-trump-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump officials cancel major solar project in latest hit to renewable energy
items.summary: <p>Esmeralda 7 in Nevada would have produced enough energy to power 2m homes</p><p>The <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a> has killed a huge proposed <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/04/trump-clean-energy-cuts-democrat-states">solar power project</a> in <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/nevada">Nevada</a> that would have been one of the largest in the world, indicating that the White House plans to attack not only wind power but all renewable energy.</p><p>On Thursday, the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) changed the status of the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2024/jan/23/us-solar-energy-transition-land">Esmeralda 7</a> project to say its environmental review has been “<a href="https://eplanning.blm.gov/eplanning-ui/project/2020804/510">cancelled</a>”, the climate publication Heatmap <a href="https://heatmap.news/sparks/esmeralda-7-canceled-nevada-solar?utm_campaign=heatmap_am&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;_hsenc=p2ANqtz--CpT8Gwxiq5a7QEtKdFelple7fVwNWk8nj4O4AHIve0D_2mXXz87nFNdjpYLS9YvluiQaEb1GCApvdg6oeacqKDz0b99SLjOSigga7ilUOzg_Xzvs&amp;_hsmi=384580979&amp;utm_content=384580979&amp;utm_source=hs_email">first reported</a>.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/10/trump-officials-drop-major-solar-power-project-in-another-renewable-energy-attack">Continue reading...</a>
